subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Stress Theory of Aging
Mitochondrial Quality Control and Stress Response Theory of Aging

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production causing mtDNA damage and a vicious cycle of oxidative stress driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS generation, oxidative damage to mtDNA, and the self-amplifying cycle of mitochondrial dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS and oxidative damage accumulation impairing enzyme activities and mitochondrial function with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial ROS production, oxidative damage, and decline in antioxidant defenses contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mutation in mitochondrial complex II to increased ROS production and oxidative stress driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS causing molecular damage and energetic decline contributing to muscle aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes trade-off of high mitochondrial activity producing ROS that cause mtDNA mutations and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Stress Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers mitochondrial energetic decline, ROS production, mtDNA damage, and impaired quality control leading to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Stress Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial dysfunction causing oxidative stress and apoptosis contributing to muscle aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Stress Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial dysfunction, ROS damage, and links to neurodegenerative aging diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Stress Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details mitochondrial dysfunction, ROS, impaired dynamics, mitophagy, and HMGB1’s dual role in aging and inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Stress Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related mitochondrial energetic decline and functional restoration by light improving aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Stress Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mtDNA mutation accumulation, ROS damage, maternal inheritance, and bioenergetic decline driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Stress Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mtDNA mutation accumulation to mitochondrial respiratory deficiency impairing bone formation and accelerating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Stress Response Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial unfolded protein response (UPRmt) as a protective mechanism maintaining mitochondrial quality and delaying aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Stress Response Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes mitophagy-independent mitochondrial maintenance in axons via fission-fusion dynamics as key to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Stress Response Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes balance of mitochondrial fission, fusion, and mitophagy regulating mitochondrial quality and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Stress Response Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows mitochondrial translation and dynamics crosstalk regulating lifespan via autophagy and lysosome biogenesis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Stress Response Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on increased mitochondrial proton leak mediated by uncoupling proteins as an adaptive mitochondrial quality control mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Maintenance and Repair Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes msh1 gene role in maintaining mtDNA integrity and preventing deletions that accelerate aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Maintenance and Repair Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of mtDNA deletions flanked by direct repeats contributing to mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Maintenance and Repair Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-dependent decline in mitochondrial DNA base-excision repair capacity leading to mtDNA damage accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Maintenance and Repair Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes mitochondrial recombination as a repair mechanism increasing with age to maintain mitochondrial function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Maintenance and Repair Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress-induced peroxidative damage to mitochondrial membranes impairing function and driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial-Nuclear Crosstalk and Epigenetic Regulation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial-nuclear retrograde signaling and mitochondrial regulation of nuclear epigenome affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial-Nuclear Crosstalk and Epigenetic Regulation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial dysfunction driving stem cell aging via ROS, mtDNA damage, and sirtuin-mediated regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial-Nuclear Crosstalk and Epigenetic Regulation Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes interplay between mitochondrial damage and lysosomal degradation impairing autophagy and promoting aging in postmitotic cells.
